intro: Potentilla campestris, commonly known as field cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe, Asia, and North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, bright yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, palmately compound, with five to seven leaflets that are oval to lance-shaped. Potentilla campestris is often found in open habitats such as fields, roadsides, and waste areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
